text:
I migrated from Travis to GitHub Actions (did it several times before and it worked flawless).
Now I get in the output a few "travis" variables, that shouldn't be there at all, since no single travis file/access is left. Anyone has clue what's going on?
```┌ Info: Deployment criteria:
│ - ✔ ENV["TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG"]="" occurs in repo="<http://github.com/roflmaostc/Noise.jl.git|github.com/roflmaostc/Noise.jl.git>"
│ - ✘ ENV["TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST"]="" is "false"
│ - ✔ ENV["TRAVIS_TAG"]="" is (i) empty or (ii) a valid VersionNumber
│ - ✘ ENV["TRAVIS_BRANCH"]="" matches devbranch="master" (if tag is empty)
│ - ✔ ENV["DOCUMENTER_KEY"] exists
│ - ✔ ENV["TRAVIS_EVENT_TYPE"]="" is not "cron"
└ Deploying: ✘```
Source: <https://github.com/roflmaostc/Noise.jl/runs/1557240723?check_suite_focus=true>

elements.text:
I migrated from Travis to GitHub Actions (did it several times before and it worked flawless).
Now I get in the output a few "travis" variables, that shouldn't be there at all, since no single travis file/access is left. Anyone has clue what's going on?

┌ Info: Deployment criteria:
│ - ✔ ENV["TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG"]="" occurs in repo="github.com/roflmaostc/Noise.jl.git"
│ - ✘ ENV["TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST"]="" is "false"
│ - ✔ ENV["TRAVIS_TAG"]="" is (i) empty or (ii) a valid VersionNumber
│ - ✘ ENV["TRAVIS_BRANCH"]="" matches devbranch="master" (if tag is empty)
│ - ✔ ENV["DOCUMENTER_KEY"] exists
│ - ✔ ENV["TRAVIS_EVENT_TYPE"]="" is not "cron"
└ Deploying: ✘

text:
Autodetection of Documenter failed.
I needed to specify `deploy_config` in `deploydocs(repo = "<http://github.com/roflmaostc/Noise.jl.git|github.com/roflmaostc/Noise.jl.git>", deploy_config=Documenter.GitHubActions)`
